messages: 4c681049601b3c374f1d2c0077c99049 (23:22): like as a joke it could be at saywhaa.com
4c681049601b3c374f1d2c0077c99049 (23:22): but maybe you want to do it as a serious joke joke like  voicesearchplus.com
4c681049601b3c374f1d2c0077c99049 (23:22): and it is search boxes for google/bing/twitter
4c681049601b3c374f1d2c0077c99049 (23:23): and down in the footer you explain the "plus"

52b6d0acc8828468b85687739d7b5abb (23:37): so, which is better practice: (a) one .css file per web page where shared rules are downloaded in each .css file; or (b) 2 <links> per page, one to a site.css and another to a page.css?
52b6d0acc8828468b85687739d7b5abb (23:38): or i guess (c) a single site.css which has all the rules for all pages in a site
0acb83f1a9cfc48f061ff5555e61c6bf (23:38): I use page specific CSS selectors
0acb83f1a9cfc48f061ff5555e61c6bf (23:38): 52b6d0acc8828468b85687739d7b5abb: less the CSS import order or files matter the easier it will be maintain in the future

52b6d0acc8828468b85687739d7b5abb (23:40): which is better from a not-maintenance standpoint?  the only reason i ask is because chrome started showing us the % of rules which aren't applied to any element on the current page
52b6d0acc8828468b85687739d7b5abb (23:40): (suggesting that noise in the .css file is bad)
4c681049601b3c374f1d2c0077c99049 (23:40): unused style rules are merely an indicator of a possible optimization
52b6d0acc8828468b85687739d7b5abb (23:40): so you would favor a single site-wide css?
2360aabaa09d5610935ee7e2283f0780 (23:41): 52b6d0acc8828468b85687739d7b5abb, 4c681049601b3c374f1d2c0077c99049 where is this unused selector display? that's freakin sweet
4c681049601b3c374f1d2c0077c99049 (23:41): 52b6d0acc8828468b85687739d7b5abb: probably, but not if that means a 300kb css file
52b6d0acc8828468b85687739d7b5abb (23:46): do any of you strongly recommend an alternative to less/css?
4c681049601b3c374f1d2c0077c99049 (23:46): sass seems wiser at this point
4c681049601b3c374f1d2c0077c99049 (23:46): if you use less, do NOT use it clientside
2360aabaa09d5610935ee7e2283f0780 (23:47): 4c681049601b3c374f1d2c0077c99049: how can you use it client-side?
52b6d0acc8828468b85687739d7b5abb (23:47): i was favoring less cause there's serverside support in .net
4c681049601b3c374f1d2c0077c99049 (23:47): less.js runs on node or runs in browser
2360aabaa09d5610935ee7e2283f0780 (23:47): saw it when it was Ruby (I think)
